reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The tenth European Development Fund (EDF 10) is set up by an internal agreement between the EU member states. The fund is separate from the community budget and is used for financing of Community aid under the multi-annual financial framework for the perio d 2008-2013 in accordance with the Partnership Agreement between the ACP-EU Partnership Agreement. The total amount of the fund is 22 682 million euros of which 21 966 million euros is allocated for the ACP countries 286 million euros for the Overseas Coun tries and Territories (OCT) and 430 million euros for support expenditures.The ACP-EU Partnership Agreement is the basis relations between EU and the Sub-Saharan Africa Caribbean and Pacific countries. It is both a development policy instrument and part of the EU foreign relations framework. According to the agreement the goal of development cooperation is to provide sufficient funding and relevant technical assistance and thereby promote the endeavors of the ACP countries to achieve the objectives of the agreement. ACP-EU partnership focuses on poverty alleviation and eradication according to sustainable development in accordance with the objective of gradual integration of the ACP countries to the world economy. Additional funding is granted in order to be able to fulfill the 2016 payments. The transferred funds from 2015 will be used for the purpose due to limitations set by the 2016 annual financial frame.

The tenth European Development Fund (EDF 10) is set up by an internal agreement between the EU member states. The fund is separate from the community budget and is used for financing of Community aid under the multi-annual financial framework for the perio d 2008-2013 in accordance with the Partnership Agreement between the ACP-EU Partnership Agreement. The total amount of the fund is 22 682 million euros of which 21 966 million euros is allocated for the ACP countries 286 million euros for the Overseas Coun tries and Territories (OCT) and 430 million euros for support expenditures.The ACP-EU Partnership Agreement is the basis relations between EU and the Sub-Saharan Africa Caribbean and Pacific countries. It is both a development policy instrument and part of the EU foreign relations framework. According to the agreement the goal of development cooperation is to provide sufficient funding and relevant technical assistance and thereby promote the endeavors of the ACP countries to achieve the objectives of the agreement. ACP-EU partnership focuses on poverty alleviation and eradication according to sustainable development in accordance with the objective of gradual integration of the ACP countries to the world economy. Additional funding is granted in order to be able to fulfill the 2016 payments. The transferred funds from 2015 will be used for the purpose due to limitations set by the 2016 annual financial frame.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
